intro: Plagianthus linariifolia, commonly known as the common flax-leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow to orange. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that give it its common name, and it is often found in grasslands and coastal areas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Plagianthus linariifolia is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
